group_1.narration: This is the world of a story@once drawn of a country@ruled by the Fire Demon King@and the Ice Queen, where@Christmas traditions are underway.
This time, let's tell the tale@of one of the many little customs@the Fire Demon King's servant practices.

group_1.textLeft: S-so cooold~...!
You're doing just fine...?

group_1.textRight: Because I am the servant of the "Ice" Queen.
But it must be difficult for you as a servant@of the "Fire" Demon King...

group_1.textLeft: It's cold, but...if it's for the Demon King,@I can handle this much...!

group_1.narration: One such custom the@Demon King's servant practices...@Is to secretly prepare@a Christmas present for the Demon King@who always works so hard.
It is a very important custom for the servant,@who has watched over the Demon King@since she was little.

group_1.textRight: So what you're looking for is...

group_1.textLeft: An "ice flower that won't melt@from even the hottest flame".
Please lead the way.

group_1.textRight: Sure, leave it to me, as this is a request@from the Ice Queen.
It's here.

group_1.textLeft: This is an "ice flower"...@[chara:303051:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:303051:cheek_1][chara:303051:face_mtn_ex_011.exp.json][chara:303051:lipSynch_1]How beautiful!
Why isn't this sold in a store? Is it difficult to grow?

group_1.textRight: No, it's not, but they're hard to get onto@store shelves.

group_1.textLeft: Um, it's okay if I take one, isn't it?

group_1.textRight: Yeah. Go ahead.

group_1.textLeft: Woah— it's freezing cold to just barely touch it...@need to hurry with the scissors...
Oh no—@I can't get the blades to cut at all...!

group_1.textRight: Even with your special scissors...?

group_1.textLeft: Eh—...?@But these are normal scissors...

group_1.textRight: Hm...? Ordinary scissors can't cut the stem@of an ice flower.

group_1.textLeft: Eh—...?! Is that true?

group_1.textRight: ...Yeah, fire won't melt them@nor will scissors cut them,
so we can't put ice flowers onto the store shelves.
...Were you by chance unaware of that?

group_1.textLeft: Y-yeah...
Ah— if you're so knowledgeable about them,@then you must know a way to harvest them?

group_1.textRight: ...Sorry, I don't.
I thought for sure a servant of the@Fire Demon King...
...would have a special way to gather them...

group_1.textLeft: What do I do...

group_1.textRight: ...You can't just give her another present?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, this year I really want to give a "flower"@to the Demon King.
Last year I gave her a normal flower@that filled her with joy,
but she ended up accidentally using a little@too much power and burned it up.
That mistake left her so depressed...

group_1.textRight: That's why you want "an ice flower that won't melt@from even the hottest flame"...
...to give as a present, then...

group_1.textLeft: Yeah...
A long time ago the flower appeared@in a picture book the Demon King loved,
so I'm sure she would love it...

group_1.textRight: Picture book...?

group_1.narration: "To save her friend from her high fever,@the heroine embarks on a journey@to find 'an ice flower that@won't melt from even the hottest flame'."

group_1.textLeft: Something like that, I think? I don't remember@the details, though...

group_1.textRight: I loved it too, especially...

group_1.narration: Her hands were on the verge of freezing,@but she did not let go of the flower stem.@To save her friend,@she desperately needed this "ice flower".
And what happened next?@With a pitter and a patter,@water began to drip down.
Despite the ice flower being unable@to melt from even the hottest flame,@the girl's warm heart and thoughts of her friend@began to melt the ice flower's stem.

group_1.textRight: I love this part...
I wanted to serve my Queen@with such a strong heart.

group_1.textLeft: Wait!
Right there—@isn't that the way to harvest it...?

group_1.textRight: Ah—...that may be.

group_1.textLeft: ...I'll try.
I won't let my heartfelt feelings for the Demon King@lose to this...I'll be okay!
(It truly is incredibly cold...!@My hands...are freezing...)

group_1.textRight: Hey, are you alright...?
It's just a picture book. I don't know if it's true@or not, so you should stop...
...No, you can do it.

group_1.textLeft: Y-eah...un-til it me-lts...@I will...not...let go...!
(Because the Demon King, year after year...)
(Looks forward to her Christmas present...!)

group_1.textRight: Ah—... It melted...

group_1.textLeft: I-I did it!@This will make the Demon King so happy!

group_1.narration: Christmas Day has arrived.@The Fire Demon King,@with stocking hung by her bedside,@found inside a beautifully wrapped box.
Trembling with heart aflutter,@the Fire Demon King opened the box@and leaped from her bed with joy.

group_1.textLeft: Look at this!
Santa gave me the most wonderful present!

group_1.textRight: Oh, what could it be?

group_1.textLeft: An ice flower!
Even my fire won't melt this one!

group_1.narration: Having received such@a lovely Christmas present,@the Fire Demon King gave@the biggest smile she could.
The Demon King's servant smiled@with all her heart in kind,@as her lady's smiling face@is the greatest Christmas present@she could ask for.
